medical_history.chief_complaint: RUQ pain radiating to back for the past two days with cramping and nausea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began two days ago with RUQ pain that radiated to the back, cramping, and nausea. The pain intensified this morning and was constant in the epigastric area. There was no vomiting, fever, chills, chest pain, shortness of breath, lightheadedness, or headaches. The last bowel movement was two days ago with no diarrhea or blood. The patient had a similar episode of RUQ pain three months ago, which was less intense.
